citation.article-title: Bacillus pallidus sp. nov., isolated from forest soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus pallidus sp. nov.
Bacillus pallidus (pal.li′dus. L. masc. adj. pallidus pale, the light pink colour of colonies).
Cells are Gram-positive, motile by means of peritrichous flagella, spore-forming and rod-shaped (0.7–1.0×1.8–3.5 μm).
Colonies are circular, flat and light pink after 2 days cultivation at 37 °C on TYB medium.
Growth occurs at 15–42 °C (optimum 30–37 °C) and pH 6.0–8.5 (optimum pH 7.0–8.0).
Grows in the absence of NaCl but does not grow in the presence of 3 % NaCl.
Positive for hydrolysis of casein and gelatin, but negative for hydrolysis of Tween 80, chitin, starch, DNA, pectin and tyrosine.
Oxidase, β-galactosidase, arginine dihydrolase, lipase, methyl α-d-glucosidase, ornithine decarboxylase, lysine decarboxylase and urease activities are absent.
Nitrate and nitrite are not reduced.
H2S (triple-sugar iron test) is not produced.

Utilizes aesculin, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate and d-xylose, but not N-acetylglucosamine, d-adonitol, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, arbutin, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, d-fructose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-galactose, d-gentiobiose, d-glucose, glycerol, glycogen, inositol, inulin, 5-ketogluconate, d-lactose, amygdalin, d-lyxose, maltose, mannitol, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl α-d-mannoside, methyl β-d-xyloside, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, d-salicin, sorbitol, l-sorbitose, starch, sucrose, d-tagatose, trehalose, turanose, xylitol or l-xylose (API CHB tests).
Major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 42.3 mol% (HPLC).
The type strain, CW 7T (=KCTC 13200T=CCTCC AB 207188T=LMG 24451T), was isolated from a forest soil in Anhui Province, China.
